content:
:white_check_mark: Approved the contribution.
Comment: Ok, thanks for your contribution

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'accepte cette contribution

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That's a good task with short description but quiet nontrivial solution and a few caveats.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Ok, thanks for your contribution

Same comments as 5DN1L, about plurality in 'seconds'.
Additional remarks : You can extend your CoC to all mode (time and reverse are also ok, if you provide additional test with 0 and with 1 seconds)

Just gone through the whole suggestion and changed some stuff:
- Improved the clarity of the statement.
- Changed 0 <= day <= 31 to 1 <= day <= 31 in the input. (You can't have 0/01/22)
- Improved the stub generator.

Output section 
* Please change "secondes" to "seconds".
* I think you may have to specify that the plural form of the words will always be used even when w, d, H, M or S equals 1.

e.g. the correct form should be "1 second" instead of "1 seconds", but in this clash the accepted output is "1 seconds".

Alternatively, you may want to ask the player to change the plural form to the singular form whenever the relevant number is 1. This is more correct, but will require more changes. If you choose this option, some cases will need to be modified to test the answers involving 1 more.

Constraints section
* Please remove the extra bracket in the first constraint.
* hour should be at most 23 not 24. (twice)
* Please change "secondes" to "second" (twice).

Cases
* Please change "secondes" to "seconds".

Thanks.

Finally, I changed the units to be in the correct form: singular for value 1, plural otherwise.
Thanks for the complete feedback

Well, you are two commenting the plurality in the units, I changed it:
I also followed your advice to extend it  to fastest and reverse.
Thanks for the feedback
